dialogue: Mother was Miss Del Rio. They all moved to New Orleans after Katrina. Parents divorced... no father in the picture. Short stints hairdressing, flight attendant. Married to husband, Ray Masters. Works in his family's oil and gas business. Digs deeper.
Then nothing.
No criminal record... A couple of domestic complaints... no arrests.
So, Madison, who is your hitman?
Are you enjoying your pie?
Ron.
Madison.
Devoted wife.
Mm hmm...and to answer your question, he doesn't let me work. He doesn't really let me do anything. Can I have a bite of that pie?
He has me on this stupid diet.
Oh, this is good.
Oh, look, he's so cute. You a dog person?
Yeah. I don't really get cats. Kinda creepy...you know?
Yeah, all those stories...
The ones about jealous cats smothering babies, that kind of stuff.
Uh huh.
Not, like, personally, but I've heard it from like, a lot of people.
I agree.
No sir, but we're herding suspects now.
Ugh... an utter Cat-astrophe.
You too. And what do you do...? Off his look.
Oh. I'm sorry, I forgot.
Yeah. I can't believe I'm doing this.
So...how does this usually work?
I don't know. I'm just really scared.
He's a bad person. You don't know what I married into... and just keeps getting worse and worse.
Did you always know you wanted to be a...?
Do you ever think about... like, if you did something else? Or if you chose a different path?
Well, we all have regrets...
Wish I could do that. I just feel like I'm in prison, and I am going to die in prison.
But I'm not going to die in prison, because what if me coming here and meeting with you is the best decision I've ever made because it's for me.
Sorry. Shit, it's him. I have to go. I brought the...

Listen, there's nothing in this for me - technically, I'm un-employing myself here, but do your future self, the one that deserves a happy, fulfilling life, that can still have that, a big favor. Take what's in there and get a new life. Right now. Don't go home.
And, if you need anything or if you change your mind... you have my number.
Hello?
Okay, who's going long?
There it is!
No, no, no. I don't buy it.
You're not a hitman. You can't be. You cuddled puppies, you played with kids, you've opened every door for me tonight. And yet...you kill people for money?
And I tried looking you up, and nothing. It's like you don't exist.
Okay. We'll see about that. How many? Wait, I don't want to know. What? Does a gentleman not kill and tell?
And yet you kill them.
Right. So what's the difference between the real you and...your occupation.
Tell me a little more about the unprofessional side.
Good. I don't want you too professional.
What? Do I scare you?
Should I be scared?
Okay. You want to know all about me, but what about you?
You know all you need to know.
I was once told I think too much to be a good lover. She said exceptional sex requires a lack of thought - a certain amount of animal abandon...
I liked Ron - he wasn't a thinker, he was a doer. .

...So, I don't know if I was just better as Ron, or if it was that electric charge going through both of us...After all, in her mind, she was having sex with someone who had murdered a bunch of people, and I was having sex with someone who was clearly capable of having a lover killed.
I'm not proud to say this, but it upped my game.
You know, I haven't been with anyone else in so long... Can I tell you something?
This is fun.
I like this, us.
Fuck normal.
Do you wanna see me again?
It doesn't have to be.
I suppose it is. A charged moment, then --
Good. I don't want to.
I will see you when I see you.

Okay, what's your next line, "don't fall in love with me?" I know what this is. I don't want to know where you live, or what you're doing at any given moment. We're just going to meet here whenever we want and nothing outside of here matters.
Well, okay.
So, we agree to the terms?
Where do I sign?
Anywhere else I need to sign?
Anywhere else I need to initial?
We gotta make sure...this document...is air tight.
The Freudian concepts of the Id and the Superego, are, in Jung's view, in constant struggle with each other. The "Superego" is our conscience.
It rewards us for behaving properly, adhering to societal norms and moralistic standards.
So, the "Id"...
...As humans we have desires and instincts that are primitive... Legs, arms, and skin.
...Urges that are solely based in the pursuit of pleasure, ignoring the consequences...
...now the "Ego" is the middle-man. The bridge between instinct and logic...
...the law and the lawless. Forever attempting to maximize pleasure while minimizing the cost...
Welcome to Madison Airlines.
Somewhere hot... and tropical. Please follow me to the upper deck.
Shh. Sir, please unbuckle your belt. It's for your own safety.
We're anticipating heavy turbulence... So prepare to brace for impact.
I know we agreed to not talk about stuff like this, and you don't have to answer if you don't want to, but how do you do it and not get caught?
You know the dirty secret is, most murders go unsolved - especially around here. So, my M.O. is to engage in a more controlled environment, then move the body somewhere that says - "chaos."
Isn't that messy?
No! Lower. Lower. Okay!

The heart. I mean, certain areas like the head or the neck, the blood has nowhere to go, but out. Talk about a bloody mess. I mean, and people, we're just big skin- bags of blood, and you have this big, beautiful thoracic cavity to hold it all in, until you move the body... set the scene, tell the story you want them to find.
You know, I was always too shy to go out for the high school play, but I had somehow found my stage, and each arrest was like a standing ovation.
I got something we can play with.
Pick a hand.
You lose.
What do you think? I'm a woman living by myself, I gotta protect myself. Plus, all that talk of murder freaked me out.
You have a gun.
Are you going to show me how to use it or what?
We have to leave our love nest at some point, don't we?
Okay. I suck.
Why is this so hard?
Why don't you show me, hot shot.
That's my usual distance.
Okay, hear me out: if the moon controls the tides, and if we're mostly water, then how could a full moon not affect you? Think about it.
No, it makes sense.
Okay - I didn't know I was out with Neil fuckin' deGrasse Tyson.
Let's go dance, white boy.
Wait, wait, wait... Tell me this one more time - he's trying to put a hit out on me?
And he saw you in person?
And he knows what you do?
So...are you going to kill me?
Are you gonna kill me?
Then I have nothing to worry about.
He won't. He won't.
So, I ask the modern day jury, what is your verdict?
You scared me! Tries to read her.
Why are you looking at me like that?
You're looking at me like something's wrong.
Okay, what are you doing? Look, Ron, it's too early for this shit.
That he's dead? Yeah - how do you know that?
Yeah, but who told you?

I was obviously going to tell you, but I'm still just processing it all. I really don't know what to do with it. It's a weird position to be in. Am I supposed to be playing the role of grieving widow? Well, I don't know how to pretend. Was he a good guy? No. Did I love him? I mean, I loved him. People grieve in different ways. I just have to know if you had anything to do with this.
Okay, I just had to ask. I'm sorry.
It's okay... I understand.
I'm really happy you're here.
Me too. So what happened? Did the police call you to let you know?
Yeah.
And what are they saying? Any suspects? Arrests?
I think there was a drug deal going on. They just found him shot.
I'm so scared.
I know, it's so weird, so out of the blue. You don't have to be scared. Why would you be scared?
Because I killed him.
Yeah.
You told me yourself, he was gonna come and kill me!
Technically...
He was either passed out or asleep.
Yeah, and I made a story, and they're believing it.
Why are you getting so worked up about this? You do this shit all the time.
What are you talking about?
You're a cop?!
You've been lying to me this whole time?!
Who the fuck is Gary?
I don't even know your name!!
Gary?
They've called three times - something must be going on... a situation probably...
Hey, how's it going, Claude?
Don't. Just leave, whatever your name is.
I might have walked in as Ron, but I left as Gary.
Wait, what?!
Well it wasn't me!
I didn't kill him! Who's accusing me of this? This is bullshit! You out of all people should know I wasn't capable of this!
I just know what they've told me...
Which is what?
He got shot buying drugs! Guy was an addict!
Not that long ago, at Virgo's.

Yes, the club. I was walking out of Virgo's with this guy that I met on the dance floor and boom, I run into Ray. Ray loses his shit when he sees me with this other guy and starts running his mouth, gets all threatening, and fucking grabs me...And then this other guy, trying to protect me, he pulls out a gun out of nowhere and sticks it in Ray’s face...
Shit, so am I. Good men are rare these days. He stood up for me, he protected me. So, you know what? If they find him, you let me know.
Yeah, because it wasn't.
-- Don't act like a million dollars is nothing. Don't fucking lie to me. You know what I'm capable of.
Ray's family has money - they do shit like this, they take out insurance. Look, I don't even know if I get any of that money. For all I know, he changed the beneficiary when we broke up.
Listen, I have no mind for financial stuff - Ray would talk about money and investments and shit like that, and it would just go over my head.
I'm giving you the truth!
Fuck you! I didn't do it. How dare you come into my own house and accuse me. You know what?! Get the fuck outta my house!
There is no together!

You know what? I'm done. I'm done answering questions from a fucking hitman. You’re not a cop - let them find out who really did it - I’ve told you everything that I know! I had nothing to do with this! Ray was a druggie loser asshole.
Good - I don't need it.
Great.
Fine by me.
Fuck.
I'm fucked.
What just happened?
I put drugs in his beer. I hope I didn't over-do it... if he wakes up, I'm going to jail... I drugged a cop. I'm so fucked.
What are you doing?
What's that for?
Commitment.
We can't get away with killing a cop.
Oh God. So... what's our story?
Are we really doing this?
We don't have a choice. Look, I know you're taking a big leap with me and there are some factual loose threads we'll be dealing with. But I think I'm in love with you.
It's always a leap... And for the record, I think I'm in love with you, too. For better or worse?
Right.
So, we're in this till the end? Till death us do part?
Yes, because I don't believe in divorce.
I'm kidding.
So, do we agree on the terms?
I do.
Anywhere else I need to sign?
Initial here.
I know I've thrown a lot at you this semester, but that's the point, isn't it?
Best of luck to all of you on your final exam. You may begin.
You see all those white birds out there? Notice the long, orange bill, right? That is the white ibis. Look at those eyes... crazy.
Well, daddy was the nicest guy I'd ever met, even though he was being all tough, I could tell it was an act.
And your mother, well, what can I say, it was love at first sight... she ended up making a new man out of me... But to answer your question, we met at a magical little place called the Please U Cafe.
Are you enjoying your pie?
All pie is good pie.
It sure is.
